function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'malloc'?

Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'free'?
Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i<N' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i<N' always executed?

dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i<N' without passing through its header block?

data_dependency: Is variable 'argc' used after its definition?
Is variable 'argv' used after its definition?
liveness: Is variable 'A' live at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'k' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'for(int i=0; i<N; ++i){' be considered dead code?
